title: Warriors-Wolves ppd. after Minneapolis shooting
content: The NBA has postponed Saturday's game between the Timberwolves and Warriors in Minneapolis amid growing unrest after a Saturday morning confrontation with federal immigration officers ended in a man being shot and killed.

title: Sources: Steelers plan to hire McCarthy as coach
content: The Steelers are planning to hire former Cowboys and Packers coach Mike McCarthy as their next head coach, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Source: Guardians extend Ramirez through 2032
content: The Guardians extended star third baseman Jose Ramirez four years through 2032, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Bournemouth shocks Liverpool with late winner
content: Amine Adli scrambled home a winner as Liverpool's dismal title defence suffered another setback with a dramatic 3-2 defeat at Bournemouth.

title: Bediako: Alabama 'can win it all' with him back
content: Hours before his second collegiate debut after a stint as a two-way player in the NBA, and a G League standout, Charles Bediako said Alabama could win a national title with him on the roster.

title: Morant out past trade deadline with elbow sprain
content: Grizzlies star guard Ja Morant will miss at least three weeks due to a UCL sprain in his left elbow, meaning that he will be sidelined through the Feb. 5 trade deadline.

title: UFC doubles bonuses, adds incentive for finishes
content: The UFC is doubling the amounts of its long-running fight night bonuses and will also award a bonus for every single finish inside the Octagon.

title: Shiffrin earns first giant slalom podium in 2 years
content: Mikaela Shiffrin finished third at Saturday's World Cup giant slalom event in Czechia, her first podium finish in the discipline in two years.

title: üèà Reid's NFL draft QB Hot Board: Mendoza top?
content: Who are the best quarterbacks in the 2026 class? We sized up the top 12, starting with Fernando Mendoza and Ty Simpson.

title: Midseason lessons for all 30 NBA teams: Trade dramas, standings surprises dominate the first half
content: What have we learned about every team throughout the first half of 2025-26? Tim Bontemps canvasses the league.

title: 8 things to know about the men's college hoops season
content: The good (Nebraska), not-so-good (Kentucky) and interesting (dominant freshmen) of the 2025-26 season so far.

title: 'You should've never been born': How Buss family infighting drove the $10B sale of the Lakers
content: The post-Jerry Buss era was defined by resentment, dysfunction and conflict -- and ended with the loss of the most valuable family-owned franchise in the world.

title: Broncos' elite defense has a weakness the Patriots are set up to exploit
content: Denver's D has been vulnerable to big plays from running backs and tight ends in the middle of the field.

title: Justin Gaethje: The UFC's most exciting MMA experience
content: Justin Gaethje meets Paddy Pimblett on Saturday with a plan to cement his most exciting UFC fighter status.

title: Can Carlos Alcaraz finally win the Australian Open?
content: Alcaraz has won the other three majors twice each -- but never made it past the quarterfinals at the Australian Open.

title: Two NFL conference title games, two matchup previews: We have predictions, score picks and X factors
content: Drake Maye vs. Jarrett Stidham. Matthew Stafford vs. Sam Darnold. We have picks, stats to know and more for the AFC and NFC title games.

title: Breaking down Pats-Broncos, Rams-Seahawks via Next Gen Stats
content: Drake Maye vs. the blitz? Sam Darnold using play-action? Here are key metrics to help analyze Sunday's games.

title: Leicester City? Texas Western? A search for Indiana football's best cross-sport comparison
content: Was Indiana's title the greatest story in sports history? There might never be an objective answer, but we polled our experts for comparable arguments in other sports.

title: Premier League Power Rankings: Rating on performances, not results
content: A look at all 20 teams, including why Liverpool, Chelsea and Tottenham are better than the table suggests.

title: Ranking the 100 best college football players from the 2025 season
content: Which players take the top spots? After an obvious choice at No. 1, the decisions weren't easy. Our experts tried to crack the code.

title: Women's Bracketology: Chavez, OT win boost Sooners' hopes of hosting
content: Three straight losses sent the Sooners tumbling out of the top 16. They return after beating South Carolina.

title: Can Sam Darnold overcome his nemesis -- the L.A. Rams -- to get to Super Bowl?
content: Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold has struggled with turnovers against the Rams. Will Sunday be different?

title: How NFL players prepare for the coldest games of the year
content: Even as beards freeze and fingers lose feeling, NFL players find ways to handle ridiculously cold temperatures.

title: Predictions for rest of MLB offseason: Where will the best ace available sign? Who will make a major trade?
content: How will the rest of free agency play out? Here's what our experts think could go down between now and spring training.

title: The new Mets are better than the old Mets -- and we can prove it
content: New York will have a new look for 2026. We break down what has changed and whether the team has improved.

title: NHL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus each team's top celebrity fan
content: The Canes move into the top 3, while the Penguins and Mammoth rise too. Which team was the biggest faller?

title: Top 25 portal classes: Indiana, Texas Tech reload and the Portal King comes to LSU
content: These teams nailed their top targets or won a QB battle. Others had to reload at quite a few positions.

title: Keep, cut or add? What to do with George, Markkanen and six other trending players
content: Helping you decide whether to give up on a few struggling players or believe in those who are ascending.

title: Man Shot Dead By US Immigration Agents In Minneapolis, 2nd Killing This Month
content: Federal officers have shot another person in Minneapolis amid the Trump administration's immigration crackdown, Governor Tim Walz said Saturday.

title: 'SIR To Be Extended Nationwide Soon': Poll Body Chief Gyanesh Kumar
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar announced on January 23 that the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls will soon be rolled out across all remaining states.

title: Snow, Ice Hit Western, Central US As Massive Storm Sweeps Nation
content: A massive winter storm dumped snow and freezing rain on New Mexico and Texas Saturday as it spread across the United States towards the northeast, threatening tens of millions of Americans with blackouts, transportation chaos and bone-chilling cold.

title: Maharashtra Man Kills Wife, Tries To Pass Off Murder As Cardiac Arrest
content: A 48-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly killing his wife in Maharashtra's Beed district and attempting to pass it off as a natural death, police said on Saturday.

title: 'Doctor', 'Dr' Not Exclusive To Medical Professionals: Kerala High Court
content: Justice V G Arun said that the word 'doctor' was initially used for referring to someone who had achieved the highest level of learning and had received a licence to teach in fields like theology, law and philosophy.

title: Bank Unions Call For Strike On Tuesday Over 5-Day Work Week Demand
content: Major bank employee and officer unions in India have announced a nationwide strike on January 27 to press for the introduction of a five-day work week in the banking sector.

title: Ukraine, Russia, US Agree To Continue Talks In UAE On February 1
content: Ukraine and Russia ended two days of US-brokered direct talks on Saturday and agreed to hold more next week in Abu Dhabi, even as Kyiv accused Moscow of undermining the negotiations towards ending the war by launching fresh strikes.

title: CBI Court Reverses Discharge Of Bhupesh Baghel In 'Sex CD' Case
content: A special CBI court on Saturday reversed a magisterial court order that had discharged Bhupesh Baghel from a case regarding the alleged circulation of a sleaze video purportedly depicting former minister Rajesh Munat in 2017.

title: "No Internal Democracy, Rahul Gandhi's Decision Final": Ex-Congress Leader
content: Former Congress leader Shakeel Ahmad lashed out at Congress MP Rahul Gandhi over the party's consistent electoral failures, claiming an unwillingness within the party to address the issues.

title: Manali Nightmare: 8-km Jam, Hotels 100% Occupied, Tourists Stranded On Road
content: The roads leading to Himachal's tourist hotspot of Manali in Kullu district are crammed with vehicles, stuck in massive traffic jams for hours. On one stretch, between Kothi and Manali, the jam stretched for 8 km.

title: 'Agent Feared For Life, Fired Defensive Shots': US On Minneapolis Shooting
content: A man shot and killed by federal agents in Minneapolis on Saturday was armed and "violently resisted" attempts by officers to disarm him, the US Department of Homeland Security said.

title: Missing Physiotherapy Student, 22, Found Hanging From Tree In UP
content: A 22-year-old physiotherapy student, who had been missing for two days, was found dead on Saturday with her body hanging from a tree here, police said.

title: O Panneerselvam Loyalist, Rajya Sabha MP R Dharmar Returns To AIADMK
content: R Dharmar, a Rajya Sabha MP and a loyalist of ousted AIADMK leader O Panneerselvam, on Saturday rejoined the AIADMK after calling on party general secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami here.

title: Professor Stabbed To Death By Passenger In Mumbai Local Train, Cops Checking CCTVs
content: For Alok Singh, it would have been just another day of hectic urban commute in a local train in the entertainment and financial capital of the country. But he had an argument with another passenger over a petty matter.

title: 683 Roads Blocked, 5,700 Transformers Hit: Snow Disrupts Life In Himachal
content: Widespread rainfall and heavy snowfall across Himachal Pradesh over the past 24 hours have severely disrupted public utilities, blocking hundreds of roads and affecting electricity and water supply in several districts.

title: US Immigration Under Fire Again After Detaining 2-Year-Old In Minneapolis
content: A 2-year-old was taken into US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) custody on Thursday in Minneapolis. The child was with her father when they were detained, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) said, according to a report by NBC News.

title: 16 IEDs, 100kg Explosives Seized As Security Forces Foil Maoist Plot
content: In a major success for security forces combating left-wing extremism in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district, a joint operation on Saturday led to the recovery of a significant cache of improvised explosive devices (IEDs).

title: 149 Million Passwords For Gmail, Facebook, And Netflix Leaked: Report
content: Login credentials, including usernames, passwords, of over 149 million accounts of internet firms, including Gmail, Instagram, Facebook, and Netflix, have allegedly been leaked, a report said.

title: Country Bomb Attack On Prison Convoy In Tamil Nadu, Convict Escapes
content: Two police personnel were injured after a gang threw country-made bombs at a prison escort team transporting a convict in Tamil Nadu's Perambalur district on Saturday, triggering a brief exchange of fire and a high-speed escape by the attackers.

title: 4 Feared Trapped As Major Fire Ravages Building In Hyderabad
content: At least three to four people are suspected to be trapped inside a four-storey building at Nampally here, housing a furniture shop and others, after a major fire broke out Saturday afternoon, official said.

title: Who was Alex Pretti? 37-year-old identified as man shot dead by federal officers in Minneapolis
content: In a tragic turn of events, 37-year-old Alex Jeffrey Pretti, a US citizen, was shot dead by federal immigration agents in Minneapolis. Officials confirmed that during a large immigration enforcement operation, Pretti brandished a weapon and resisted arrest, prompting a Border Patrol agent to open fire in self-defense.

title: ICC announces updated fixtures after Bangladesh exit from T20 World Cup
content: Scotland steps in for Bangladesh at the 2026 Men's T20 World Cup, co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka, after Dhaka cited security concerns for playing in India. The ICC confirmed Scotland will join Group C, with all other match details remaining unchanged. Bangladesh's refusal to travel despite security assurances led to their removal.

title: 'Thanks to AI, engineers are now artists': Google‚Äôs AI executive Logan Kilpatrick
content: AI is blurring the lines between engineering and art, with tools like ChatGPT and Gemini enabling non-technical individuals to build software. While some leaders see this as a positive refactoring of professions, others caution against over-reliance, citing potential productivity decreases and the need for human oversight in AI-generated code.

title: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet urges hands-on learning; cites 300 leaders trained
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet stresses that leaders must grasp AI to guide their companies through transformation. She advocates for leader-led training, citing a client whose 300 leaders had to directly use AI tools before progress was made. This hands-on approach, starting with top executives, is crucial for unlocking AI's potential and ensuring widespread adoption across all sectors.

title: Donald Trump praises ‚Äòbrave‚Äô British soldiers; remarks follow row over Nato, Afghanistan
content: Donald Trump lauded British soldiers as "great and very brave warriors" in Afghanistan, a day after UK PM Keir Starmer condemned Trump's earlier remarks about NATO allies' frontline contributions as "insulting and appalling." Trump reiterated his skepticism about NATO's collective defense. Starmer paid tribute to the 457 British service personnel who died in Afghanistan, calling Trump's comments deeply hurtful.

title: Bangladesh polls see 80 minority candidates; parties, independents in the fray
content: A significant 80 candidates from religious and ethnic minority groups are vying for seats in Bangladesh's upcoming national election, with 12 running independently.  While the ruling Awami League is absent, 22 parties, including BNP and Jamaat-e-Islami, have put forward 68 minority candidates.  Notably, Jamaat-e-Islami has nominated its first-ever minority candidate.

title: J&K: Jailed MP Engineer Rashid gets interim bail to attend budget session in custody
content: A Delhi court granted interim bail to J&K MP Sheikh Abdul Rashid, allowing him to attend Parliament's budget session under armed escort.  Rashid, jailed since 2019 on UAPA charges, recently defeated Omar Abdullah in the Lok Sabha polls.  This limited relief permits him to participate in parliamentary proceedings while remaining in custody, a move welcomed by his party.

title: Amazon layoffs 'announced'; company set to cut thousands of jobs
content: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.

title: When big-fat weddings become soft targets for gangs
content: Punjab's wedding venues are becoming scenes of violence, with recent shootings including an AAP sarpanch's murder in Amritsar and a deadly gang shootout in Ludhiana. These incidents highlight lax firearm ban enforcement, poor venue security, and the alarming normalization of guns at social gatherings, leaving communities fearful.

title: Palash Muchhal files defamation case against producer who alleged he cheated on Smriti Mandhana
content: Music composer Palash Muchhal has filed a ‚Çπ10 crore defamation case against Sangli-based producer Vidnyan Mane. Mane had accused Muchhal of duping him of ‚Çπ40 lakh in a film project and also alleged he cheated on cricketer Smriti Mandhana. Mane claimed Muchhal promised profits and a role in his film 'Nazaria', but the project was never completed.

title: ‚ÄòWill devour‚Äô: Trump threatens 100% tariffs if Canada makes deal with China; warns ‚Äògovernor‚Äô Carney
content: US President Donald Trump delivered a pointed ultimatum to Canada, threatening to impose 100% tariffs on Canadian goods should Prime Minister Mark Carney pursue partnerships with China. "If Governor Carney thinks he is going to make Canada a ‚ÄúDrop Off Port‚Äù for China to send goods and products into the United States, he is sorely mistaken," said Trump on Truth Social.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai sells shares worth $10.6 million, now owns ‚Ä¶
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai sold over 30,000 Alphabet Class C shares for approximately $10.6 million on January 21, 2026. This transaction occurred under a pre-established Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. The sale follows a strong year for Google stock, driven by AI advancements and a significant market valuation.

title: Crazy scenes! Hours after Scotland replace Bangladesh at T20 World Cup, BCB director quits
content: Bangladesh cricket faced fresh turmoil as BCB director Ishtiaque Sadeque resigned on the same day the ICC replaced Bangladesh with Scotland for the 2026 T20 World Cup. Sadeque cited family and personal reasons, denying any internal disputes. The ICC removed Bangladesh after it refused to play in India over security concerns. Scotland were named as the replacement based on ICC rankings.

title: Trumpiana: Tariffs, tantrums, threats, and a temblor!
content: At Davos, Donald Trump declared himself ruler, threatening economic warfare for Greenland and mocking allies. He later softened his stance, claiming a deal was formed, while also launching a new 'Board of Peace' potentially overshadowing the UN. Trump also marked his second term anniversary with a victory lap and hints at a fourth term.

title: U19 WC: Mhatre stars as India outpower New Zealand to stay unbeaten
content: India continued their dominant run in the U-19 World Cup with a seven-wicket DLS win over New Zealand in a rain-hit match. After restricting New Zealand to 135, led by strong spells from RS Ambrish and Henil Patel, India chased a revised target of 130 with ease. Skipper Ayush Mhatre starred with a rapid 27-ball 53 as India topped Group B.

title: Buffalo Bills fans rally to bring back ex-coach Sean McDermott after firing
content: A passionate Buffalo Bills fan, Maria Maisonet, created a Change.org petition to reinstate head coach Sean McDermott, accumulating over 45,000 signatures. The fan believes McDermott‚Äôs dismissal is short-sighted, overlooking his contributions and player respect. She argues McDermott deserves a chance to coach in the new stadium [New Highmark Stadium]. Bills owner Terry Pegula sensed something in the locker room, which led to McDermott‚Äôs firing.

title: WWE 2K26 release date, Attitude Era edition, platforms, roster, and more details
content: WWE 2K26 has been officially announced, set for release by March 31, 2026, with pre-orders opening January 30, 2026. The game will feature significant upgrades, a CM Punk Showcase mode, a returning Island mode with a new storyline, and new match types. An Attitude Era Edition celebrating iconic superstars has also been revealed.

title: Netflix rejects Paramount‚Äôs offer, says nothing else other than Oracle‚Äôs backing
content: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters dismissed Paramount Skydance's $108 billion bid for Warner Bros. Discovery as unrealistic, citing its heavy reliance on debt. He contrasted it with Netflix's more stable $82.7 billion all-cash offer, which is gaining traction with shareholders.  The potential merger faces significant Hollywood and regulatory scrutiny.

title: Delhi Capitals hand RCB first loss, boost WPL playoff hopes
content: Delhi Capitals secured a crucial seven-wicket win against Royal Challengers Bengaluru, handing the league leaders their first WPL defeat. After restricting RCB to 109, Delhi's chase was anchored by Laura Wolvaardt's unbeaten 42 and Jemimah Rodrigues' 24, ensuring a comfortable victory with 26 balls to spare. Nandani Sharma starred with the ball for Delhi.

title: Pak to pull out of T20 World Cup? PCB chief warns ICC after Scotland replace Bangladesh
content: The ICC has confirmed that Bangladesh will not take part in the T20 World Cup after the BCB refused to play under the published schedule. Scotland have been officially named as their replacement and will compete in Group C alongside England, Italy, Nepal and West Indies. The announcement was made on Saturday, bringing clarity to weeks of uncertainty over Bangladesh‚Äôs participation in the tournament.

title: Remember the 11pm panic of forgetting a map for school? Here‚Äôs what parenting looks like in 2026
content: Indian parenting has transformed. Gone are the days of strict rules and fear. Today, parents prioritize dialogue and understanding. Children are more expressive and seek emotional support. This shift creates a new dynamic in homes. Parents navigate technology and independence. The focus is on building relationships through communication and empathy. This evolution shapes childhood and adulthood.

title: ‚ÄòForced to bring alcohol, cigarettes‚Äô: 23 booked for ragging juniors at Bengaluru college
content: Twenty-three senior students face charges after a severe ragging incident in Devanahalli, Bengaluru. Juniors were allegedly forced to procure alcohol and cigarettes, and subjected to physical abuse with weapons. When the college's Admin Head intervened, he was also attacked. Three students have been arrested, with a manhunt underway for the others.

title: India vs Pakistan bilateral series possible? BCCI reveals ultimate condition
content: India are unlikely to play a bilateral series with Pakistan anytime soon. BCCI Vice-President Rajeev Shukla says the board will follow the Indian government‚Äôs guidance. ‚ÄúI don't think it's possible to have bilateral tours in the current situation,‚Äù he added. India last played Pakistan in 2012-13 and now follows a ‚Äúthird soil‚Äù policy for matches. Tensions increased after Operation Sindoor in 2025, and security concerns remain high, recalling the 2009 attack on the Sri Lankan team in Lahore.

title: Indian killed in US: How a timely call by a 12-yr-old from inside closet saved lives
content: A tragic shooting in Lawrenceville, Georgia, has claimed the lives of four people, including an Indian national. The incident stemmed from a family dispute. A brave 12-year-old child's quick thinking and 911 call alerted authorities. Police arrived swiftly, leading to the arrest of the suspect. The children present escaped unharmed. The Consulate General of India in Atlanta is providing assistance.

title: 'SIR turned into weapon': Rahul attacks BJP, says EC key accomplice in 'vote-chori' conspiracy
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi alleged a "strategic vote chori" in Gujarat under the guise of Special Intensive Revision (SIR), accusing the Election Commission of complicity. He claimed that the EC has become a "chief accomplice in this vote chori conspiracy". The Gujarat Congress unit also alleged widespread rigging, claiming that millions of objections were filed to target specific communities.

title: 7 yrs in jail, but no proof of dowry death: SC corrects trial court error; all about case
content: The court, while considering the submissions reiterated that only when all four ingredients are established can a death be termed as ‚Äúdowry death‚Äù under Section 304-B of the IPC. It emphasized that the prosecution must strictly prove the essential ingredients to attract the provision.

title: Seema Sajdeh opens up about amicable divorce with Sohail Khan
content: Seema Jajdeh revealed her amicable divorce from Sohail Khan, attributing it to growing apart after marrying young. She highlighted the unwavering support from Sohail's family, including Salman Khan, throughout their separation and her subsequent depression. Seema emphasized their continued family bond for their children's sake.

title: ‚ÄòMilitary-style discipline‚Äô: An employee‚Äôs account of how one leaked transcript shattered trust at work
content: An employee recounts how a management push for control unraveled after a recorded meeting captured leaders discussing staff in harsh terms, including plans for ‚Äúmilitary-style discipline.‚Äù When the transcript was accidentally shared with the entire team, trust collapsed overnight. What followed were biased evaluations, targeted employees, and a deeply toxic workplace culture. The incident highlights how performative transparency and power-driven leadership can quickly erode morale and force workers to consider exit over endurance.

title: Josh Allen injury update: Bills QB faces uncertainty amid possible surgery concerns
content: Buffalo Bills General Manager Brandon Beane has provided an update about Josh Allen's injury. According to him, the star QB may undergo right-foot surgery. Furthermore, the Bills have faced a serious crisis on their offensive line. The star quarterback has injured himself in their last game against the Denver Broncos.

title: Congress vs Tharoor escalates: Another MP calls him 'not a big part'
content: Congress MP Imran Masood stated Shashi Tharoor is "not a big part" of the party, intensifying the rift. Tharoor skipped a crucial Kerala poll meeting for a literature festival, defending his stance on Operation Sindoor and stating concerns should be raised internally.

title: UP shocker: FIR against 5 Muslim minors for ‚Äòmaking‚Äô Hindu girl wear burqa in Moradabad
content: An FIR was filed against five minor Muslim girls in Moradabad for allegedly making their Hindu friend wear a burqa. The incident, which occurred in December 2025, came to light after the girl's brother filed a complaint. Police are investigating the motive behind the alleged act, with the anti-conversion law carrying a severe penalty.

title: 'Unjust to voters, unfair to democracy': Amartya Sen says 'SIR in Bengal done in hurry'
content: Nobel laureate Amartya Sen voiced concerns over West Bengal's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, saying the exercise is "being done in a hurry," further calling it an unjust to voters and a threat to democratic participation. He highlighted personal challenges with documentation and warned that the underprivileged and minority communities are most at risk of exclusion.

title: ‚ÄòMardaani 3‚Äô OTT release: When and where to watch YRF‚Äôs cop thriller after theatrical release
content: 'Mardaani 3', starring Rani Mukerji as tough cop Shivani Shivaji Roy, releases in theatres on January 30, 2026. Produced by Yash Raj Films and directed by Abhiraj Minawala, the film streams on Netflix from March 27 after a 56-day theatrical run, exploring human trafficking and introducing the villain Amma, played by Mallika Prasad.

title: Bangladesh out of T20 World Cup: Why Scotland are chosen as replacement
content: Bangladesh have been officially replaced by Scotland in the T20 World Cup after the ICC ruled that BCB‚Äôs demands did not align with its policy. ICC CEO Sanjog Gupta informed the Board and invited Scotland, citing their strong recent performances and No.14 ranking. Scotland, seen as the most deserving associate team, will play in Group C with matches in Kolkata and Mumbai.

title: Noida Authority Gets New CEO: Krishna Karunesh appointed after protests; replaces Lokesh M
content: Krishna Karunesh, a 2011-batch IAS officer, has taken over as the new CEO of Noida Authority, replacing Lokesh M. This change follows a recent controversy surrounding the death of a software engineer and subsequent protests alleging negligence. Karunesh, previously the District Magistrate of Gorakhpur, brings a wealth of administrative experience to his new role.

title: Who wins the 2026 national title? We predict the CFP bracket
content: a 12-team playoff has turned out to be a lot of fun, but we stick with 12 for a while longer . if we simply used Schlabach's rankings for this exercise, we'd be looking at a field resembling this . it's time for the next step in the predictions process: let's talk about who will make the college football playoff .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Alexander-Arnold not told to leave Real Madrid
content: 'FC TV' crew react to real madrid's 6-1 win over Monaco . reports in Spain have said Trent Alexander-Arnold has been told by interim manager Alvaro Arbeloa to leave Real Madrid this summer . he is due to return soon and continue his career at the Bernab√©u .

title: Expert picks: 'The Highlight' is a bad matchup for 'The Baddy'
content: a matchup between lightweight fan favorites will headline the first fight card since Dec. 13 . paddy Pimblett, ESPN's no. 7-ranked lightweight, is undefeated in the UFC . his last win was a third-round knockout of Michael Chandler .

title: From 'I Love Drake Maye' to 'Bakemas': Inside the sudden cult celebrity of Drake and Ann Michael Maye
content: the "Get Up" store in westwood, Massachusetts, opened more than a decade before the new England Patriots . the store recently underwent a football-themed makeover . "a-Maye-Zing" window came to life thanks to local artist Joan Aylward .

title: NBA buzz: Live updates, trades and intel from around the league
content: the trade deadline is Feb. 5 at 3 p.m. ET, and we have you covered on all the buzz around the league as the 2025-26 season heats up . will the Memphis Grizzlies move on from Ja Morant after they've started to entertain offers .

title: Why feds call former Olympic snowboarder a 'modern-day Pablo Escobar'
content: Ryan Wedding, 44, and his associates allegedly trafficked more than $1 billion in cocaine across the u.s. and Canada . prosecutors laid out how wedding allegedly orchestrated multiple killings, including the assassination of a key government witness . wedding was born into a snow sports family .

title: Suspect in ‚Äòlargest jewelry heist in US history‚Äô deported; avoids trial
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Who should've made the top 10? What were the biggest surprises?
content: the college football top 100 player rank list from the 2025-26 season is here . the real question is, did our selection committee get it right? were there any players who should've made the list but didn't?

title: Election Commission uploads on website names of people on logical discrepancies list following Supreme Court order
content: District electoral officers will now download the list and display it at panchayat bhavans and block offices in West Bengal

title: Women employees entitled to maternity leave for third pregnancy too, reiterates Madras High Court
content: Justices R. Suresh Kumar and Shamim Ahmed direct Chief Secretary to circular their order to all HoDs so that they do not deny such benefit in future

title: Chief Minister Stalin opposes NEET for allied and health care courses
content: In a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, he says the National Commission for Allied and Health Care Professions has made a ‚Äòhasty and ad hoc decision‚Äô with ‚Äòmultiple deleterious consequences‚Äô

title: Migrant worker from Beldanga ‚Äòdied by suicide‚Äô in Jharkhand, says West Bengal Police
content: Violence erupted at¬†Beldanga¬†in Murshidabad on January 16 over the death of 30-year-old migrant worker Alauddin Sheikh; a large number of people took to the streets by blocking railway tracks and national highway for several hours

title: Internet back in two Assam districts after violence-induced shutdown
content: The district authorities said life was slowly returning to normal in Kokrajhar, but security would continue to be high

title: Home Ministry to display tableau on three new criminal laws at Republic Day parade
content: It will showcase India‚Äôs transition to a modern, technology-driven, time-bound, and citizen-centric justice system, says the Ministry

title: Delhi court acquits Medha Patkar in defamation case filed by L-G V.K. Saxena
content: Court says neither the reporter who recorded the audio-video nor any person who had seen the accused making the impugned statements had been examined as a witness

title: Citing threat to public order, MHA orders blocking of Manipur killing video
content: Social media intermediaries such as YouTube, Meta, and Google have been directed to take down the viral video of the January 21 killing of a 29-year-old man in Manipur‚Äôs Churachandpur

title: India's youth must remain prepared to take on every challenge: Rajnath
content: The Defence Minister described NCC cadets as the nation‚Äôs second line of defence and urged them to contribute to Modi-led government‚Äôs vision of making India a developed nation by 2047, while addressing a gathering of cadets in Delhi Cantonment

title: Karnataka Ombudsman has heard 108 HIV Act complaints since July 2021
content: The complaints pertained to stigma, discrimination, and denial of services between July, 2021, and December, 2025

title: Forward Bloc urges govt. to avoid bringing back Netaji‚Äôs ashes
content: At gathering to mark Netaji‚Äôs 129th birth anniversary, G. Devarajan, General Secretary of the All India Forward Bloc, asks the government to formally accept the Mukherjee Commission Report, which concluded that Bose did not die in the alleged plane crash in Taiwan, on August 18, 1945

title: SIR rollout in remaining States soon: CEC Gyanesh Kumar
content: On the eve of the Election Commission's foundation day ‚Äî also celebrated as National Voters' Day ‚Äî Mr. Kumar said the revision exercise is presently being conducted "smoothly" in 12 States and Union territories

title: R-Day celebrations: 37 contingents to take part in the parade; traffic diversions announced
content: Citizens interested in attending the event can obtain passes through the Seva Sindhu website. Around 2,000 e-passes have been issued for the general public

title: Nipah scare: RT-PCR tests conducted on bats at Kolkata zoo
content: Samples have recently been collected from bat populations in Madhyamgram, Barasat and Basirhat in West Bengal; Alipore Zoo remains the only facility in Kolkata that houses a bat enclosure, prompting health authorities to include it in the surveillance drive

title: RJD MLA Bhai Virendra questions ticket distribution by party leadership
content: In the recent Bihar Assembly election, deserving and hard-working party workers were ignored, and ‚Äòoutsiders‚Äô allocated tickets based on ‚Äòother criteria‚Äô, the Maner MLA alleges

title: Akali Dal plans to start campaigns early for 2027 Punjab Assembly polls
content: At a meeting of party functionaries on Saturday, the SAD announced plans to organise a series of rallies in all Assembly constituencies in the State starting next month and outlined its strategy to reconnect with voters.

title: CBSE makes appointment of socio-emotional, career counsellors mandatory in all affiliated schools
content: The proposed policy reform is aimed at strengthening students' mental health and providing them with career guidance

title: Congress cites The Hindu report to target Centre over Great Nicobar project, calls Modi government ‚Äòindifferent‚Äô
content: Responding to allegations of coercion of tribal communities, former Environment Minister Jairam Ramesh says, ‚ÄúThis is unacceptable and shows how the project is being bulldozed through. It is an ecological disaster‚Äù

title: 3.5 lakh ‚Äòunmapped‚Äô voters do not turn up for SIR hearing in West Bengal
content: While the last¬†date for¬†hearings for unmapped voters ended this¬†week, the Election Commission has extended the date till¬†February 7.¬†

title: Man falls into compactor machine at GHMC transfer station in Yousufguda, dies
content: While workers at the transfer station protested alleging inadequate safety measures, GHMC denied that the deceased was an employee at the site

title: Court defers bail plea of Shimjitha Musthafa
content: Magistrate M. Athira deferred the bail plea on Saturday after the prosecution cited the risk of witness tampering and the ongoing forensic analysis of her mobile phone for further investigation

title: People might not have anticipated SIR to be more cumbersome than routine revisions: Kerala CEO
content: Rathan U. Kelkar said in the previous revisions, physical verification was mostly undertaken only when objections were raised. ‚ÄúNow, officials are visiting homes and checking records in all cases. Naturally, this caused some initial concern among people,‚Äù he said.

title: TN man allegedly dies in police custody
content: He was reportedly taken into preventive custody on January 23, 2026, after residents alerted the police about finding him at Chembumukku in Vazhakkala under suspicious circumstances

title: A stage for the unheard: ITFoK opens with plays, politics and performance
content: With the theme ‚ÄòVoices in This Silence‚Äô, the 16th¬†Sixteenth International Theatre Festival of Kerala brings 23 plays from nine countries to Thrissur, turning the stage into a space for the marginalised

title: Kerala to have more than 22% of its population aged above 60 by 2036, says new RBI report
content: Kerala has topped the list for State-wise share of population aged above 60 for some years now. From 16.5% of its population aged above 60 in 2021, Kerala will have 18.7% in the category in 2026 and 22.8% by 2036

title: Kerala Hats to unveil ‚ÄòVision 2028‚Äô at homestay and tourism conclave
content: Addressing a press conference, Kerala Hats chairman says the tourism sector offers significant employment opportunities for youth

title: Kerala hoping for a better deal from the 16th Finance Commission: K.N. Balagopal
content: The State‚Äôs share of the divisible pool was down to 1.92% under the 15th¬†commission from 3.88% under the 10th¬†commission, says State Finance Minister

title: Kerala signs EoIs to establish GCCs in Thiruvananthapuram, Kochi
content: The Industries Minister says the State has signed EoIs worth ‚Çπ1.18 lakh crore in Davos, which he claims is the first instance of Kerala raising investment proposals at the WEF

title: Flex boards for PM visit: case registered against BJP Thiruvananthapuram district president
content: City Corporation imposes nearly ‚Çπ20 lakh penalty on BJP district committee in connection with the installation of flex boards, flags, and banners ahead of PM‚Äôs visit

title: Dr. Victor Frankenstein returns to life on  ITFoK stage
content: An Argentinian reimagining of Mary Shelley‚Äôs classic opens the International Theatre Festival of Kerala with a visually arresting puppet-theatre experience

title: Will find solution to human-elephant conflict: HDK to people of Hassan
content: Former Prime Minister H.D Deve Gowda says he wishes to ensure an Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) is sanctioned for Hassan, and that both the IIT and Hassan Airport are inaugurated together by Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: 20,000 voices unite at Adikavi Nannaya University to celebrate 150 years of Vande Mataram
content: Students and civil society representatives join Minister Kandula Durgesh in historic rally with 25,000-square-foot national flag near Rajamahendravaram

title: Performing arts academy for government schoolchildren in Nagapattinam
content: To be inaugurated on January 29 by Minister for School Education Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi, the Nagai Performing Arts Academy will function from a HR&CE building

title: If govt. is bankrupt, how are mega development works getting completed: CM
content: Siddaramaiah accuses BJP leaders of telling lies for the sake of politics; says of the 592 poll promises made before coming to power this time, 243 have been fulfilled

title: All set for maiden Republic Day celebrations in Amaravati
content: DGP Harish Kumar Gupta reviews the arrangements and inspects the guard of honour during the dress rehearsal of the parade; 22 tableaux highlighting various development and welfare initiatives showcased

title: Rakshasanpara in Pathanamthitta to transform from conservation landmark  to tourism spot
content: Construction work on tourism project to begin in February, with Kerala Electrical and Allied Engineering Co. Ltd and Habitat entrusted with the execution

title: Complex brain surgery performed on 11-year-old boy at Narayana Hospital
content: The boy from Vijayawada was suffering from Rasmussen‚Äôs Encephalitis, a rare and severe neurological disorder

title: Demolition of Army towers stalled amid legal battles, administrative delays
content: The prolonged delay is prompting more apartment owners to opt for a buyback option at roughly the same price they originally paid, depriving them of any return on their investment
